body.p: For a revalued asset, the distinction between an ‘impairment loss’ (‘reversal of an impairment loss’) and another ‘revaluation decrease’ (‘revaluation increase’) is important for disclosure purposes. If an impairment loss that is material to the enterprise as a whole has been recognised or reversed, more information on how this impairment loss is measured is required by IAS 36 than for the recognition of a revaluation in accordance with IAS 16.
